definition: to cut the ribbon (at an opening)
scissors/shears/clippers/CL:把[ba3]/to cut with scissors/to trim/to wipe out or exterminate

sentences.english: Dignitaries are invited to cut ribbons.
President Hu and Queen Elizabeth II cut ribbon for the exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 胡錦濤主席同伊麗莎白二世女王爲文物展開幕剪綵。

sentences.english: Opossum looked at the bright shiny ribbon wrapped around his tail.
sentences.chinese: 負鼠看着明亮的光澤圍繞他的尾巴纏剪綵。

sentences.english: Add the shadows on the ribbon.
sentences.chinese: 增加剪綵條所有的陰影部分。

sentences.english: The ribbon was then tied back together and the ceremony continued.
sentences.chinese: 後來，人們把綵帶綁起來，剪綵典禮繼續進行。

sentences.english: Their Majesties will open the new bridge today.
sentences.chinese: 王后陛下今天將爲新橋落成剪綵。

sentences.english: The remainder of the ribbon is Ultramarine Blue.
sentences.chinese: 在剪綵的剩餘部分青藍。

sentences.english: Loosen the keypad, but be careful not to tear the ribbon.
sentences.chinese: 鬆開鍵盤，但要小心，不要撕裂剪綵。

sentences.english: Mr. Qiu, representing Somso, attended the ribbon-cutting ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 裘總代表西堡紅酒參加了剪綵。

sentences.english: Our next step is drawing colorful ribbon across upper part of the camera body.
sentences.chinese: 我們的下一步是在繪製多彩的機身上部剪綵。

sentences.english: DHU Vice President & Consul Generals were cutting the ribbon on the Opening Ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 劉春紅副校長與各國駐滬總領事共同爲開幕剪綵。

sentences.english: The moist tube will come out like a spiraling ribbon bringing the can with it.
sentences.chinese: 潮溼的管道將出來像一個螺旋式並帶來了能夠剪綵。

sentences.english: The president cut the ribbon at the opening ceremony.
It was a shame that the war started without him.
sentences.chinese: 可惜歷史並沒有等他剪綵，一戰的炮聲就悄然打響了。

sentences.english: The library will be officially opened by the mayor himself.
sentences.chinese: 圖書館將由市長本人親自剪綵開業。

sentences.english: An hour after a ribbon-cutting ceremony it was deserted.
sentences.chinese: 在剪綵典禮結束一小時後，店裏就空曠無人。

definition: to make a speech/to make some remarks
